column4: hello, i need detailed information to a problem caused my a hard drive, anyone here can help?
I have a harddrive which seems to have a software problem. when i plug it in (via USB) is is listet at /dev/sdb1 (seen via "mount") but when I try to rescue data with ddrescue it can not be found
also e2fsck can not find it
ddrescue: cannot open input file: No such file or directory
mount gives: /dev/sdb1 on /media/5EDC593FDC59129F type fuseblk (rw)
is it mounted when you usd dd_rescue?
when i plug it in, i can see the drive, for a short time and have no exit to it, afterwards it dissapeares and another one "is mounted", but there is no data on that "new" disc
Ayecee: ls doesn't show files on raw block devices
!antivirus
Ayecee: makes sense
yes, it says no such directory
i tried to remount the drive, and that worked
but still there are no files on the drive
the partition needs to be unmounted to use dd_rescue
although i see that 164GB are used space via right click
/dev/sda  /dev/sda1  /dev/sda2  /dev/sda5  /dev/sda6  /dev/sda7  /dev/sdc  /dev/sdc1
no, sdc1 is my other hard drive
friend brought it to me saying it does not work on windows anymore
tried that, cant find it either
its a SATA, hooked op via a sata/usb converter
converter works, tried it on another drive
if the data is needed, unmount all the drives partitions and use foremost to attempt a data recover on the raw drive
